meanings.definition: To exaggerate or sensationalize in a theatrical manner.
meanings.sent1: She melodramatised her story to make it more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The actor melodramatised his lines to evoke emotion from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The children melodramatised their game of pretend, adding dramatic twists.
meanings.sent4: Her retelling of the event was so melodramatised, it sounded like a soap opera.
meanings.sent5: The storm outside was melodramatised by the howling wind and crashing thunder.

meanings.definition: To present in a melodramatic style.
meanings.sent1: The director melodramatised the play with exaggerated gestures.
meanings.sent2: The movie melodramatised the love story with dramatic music and close-ups.
meanings.sent3: The chef melodramatised the plating of the dish, adding unnecessary flair.
meanings.sent4: The artist melodramatised the painting with bold colors and exaggerated features.
meanings.sent5: The sunset was melodramatised by the vibrant hues painting the sky.
